instance.description: Return the status of configured BGP sessions
instance.longDescription: This question checks compatibility and reachability for each possible BGP session. Each row represents one BGP peer and contains information about the session it is configured to establish (for dynamic peers, one row will be shown per compatible remote peer). Possible statuses for each session are ESTABLISHED, NOT_ESTABLISHED, or NOT_COMPATIBLE. ESTABLISHED sessions are expected to come up. NOT_ESTABLISHED sessions will not come up because neither peer is able to reach the other and initiate the session. NOT_COMPATIBLE sessions will not come up because one or both peers are locally misconfigured (BgpSessionCompatibility can provide further insight in this case).

nodes.description: Include sessions whose first node matches this specifier

remoteNodes.description: Include sessions whose second node matches this specifier

status.description: Only include sessions for which status matches this regex

type.description: Only include sessions for which type (ibgp, ebgp_singlehop, ebgp_multihop) matches this regex
